text: Cut national insurance by 2p
additionalInfo: This is worth £450 per year for the average worker on £35,000.

text: Abolish the main rate of National Insurance for the self-employed

additionalInfo:
The means the personal allowance for pensioners will always rise with inflation, earnings or 2.5%, whichever is higher.
This is already the case for the State Pension.
text: Introduce a pension Triple Lock Plus
30 hours a week free childcare when a 9 months of age until they start school

additionalInfo:
This would mean that child benefit is calculated based on a total household income, rather than thresholds for individual earners.
It will benefit families that have a single main earner.
text: Move to a household system for child benefit
No new green levies or charges to be introduced
Introduce a mandatory National Service for all school leavers at 18
additionalInfo: The National Service would allow a choice between a competitive placement in the military or civic service roles.

text: Fund 100,000 high-quality apprenticeships by curbing the number of poor-quality university degrees
Ban the use of mobile phones during the school day
Ensure parents can see what their children are being taught, especially on sensitive matters like sex education
Introducing the Advanced British Standard which combines A-Levels and T-Levels for 16-19 year olds
Increase defence spending to the 2.5% of GDP by 2030
Introduce a legal cap on migration to guarantee that numbers will fall every year

additionalInfo: The Rwanda deportation scheme involves the UK government sending asylum seekers to Rwanda for processing and settlement, aiming to deter illegal immigration and human trafficking.
text: Deport illegal immigrants to Rwanda
Work with other countries to rewrite international asylum treaties
Increase NHS spending above inflation every year
Rewrite the Equality Act to define sex as biological sex
Abolish Stamp Duty for homes up to £425,000 for first time buyers
Recruit 8,000 more full-time, fully warranted police officers
Invest £36 billion in local roads, rail and buses, funded by cancelling the second phase of HS2
Reverse the London Mayor’s ULEZ expansion
Require local referendums for new 20mph zones and Low Traffic Neighbourhoods
Introduce a legal target and additional investment for food security
Protect agricultural land from solar farms
Cut Foreign Aid by 50%
Increase the personal tax allowance to £20,000
additionalInfo: This would save £1,500 per year for workers that earn more than £20,000 and mean that 7 million people no longer pay any income tax.

text: Scrap VAT on energy bills
Abolish inheritance tax for all estates worth less than £2M
Restart the VAT refund scheme for international tourists
Abolish Stamp Duty for homes up to £750,000
All water bosses to take a dip in British Rivers, to see how they like it
National Service to be introduced for all former prime ministers
WiFi on trains that works
Trains that work
Reintroduce Ceefax
additionalInfo: Ceefax was the world’s first teletext information service and a forerunner to the current BBC Red Button service.

text: Children in Need to finally get round to fixing Pudsey’s eye
Traffic on Northallerton High Street to be fixed by a new space bridge, bypassing both level crossings
European countries to be invited to join the UK, creating a new ‘Union of Europe’
Wallace and Gromit to be knighted, for services to Wensleydale
Build at least one affordable house
Croissants to be price-capped at £1.10 and 99 flakes to cost 99p
National Yorkshire Pudding Day to be a bank holiday (except for banks)
Ban loud snacks from cinemas and theatres
Pensions to be double-locked, but with a little extra chain on the side
Claudia Winkleman’s fringe to be Grade 1-listed
A new series of Gladiators to feature '90s Gladiators against age-appropriate contenders
Minsters' pay to be tied to that of nurses for the next 100 years
Shops that play Christmas music before December to be closed down and turned into public libraries
To combat the UK’s increasingly wet climate, all British citizens to be offered stilts
Ban on speakerphones on public transport. Offenders to be forced to live with Matt Hancock for a year
The mini golf course at Richmond swimming pool to host the open championship
MPs to live in the area they wish to serve for 4 years before election, to improve local representation
The hand dryer in the gents’ urinals at The Crown & Treaty, Uxbridge to be moved to a more sensible position.
Count Binface to represent the uk at eurovision
Abolish IR35 rules for contractors
Leave the European Convention on Human Rights
Reduce the main corporation tax rate from 25% to 20%
All frontline NHS and social care staff to pay zero basic rate tax for 3 years
Give patients vouchers for private healthcare if they can't see a GP within 3 days
Scrap Net Zero targets and Related Subsidies
Scrap interest on student loans and extend loan repayment periods to 45 years
Ban transgender ideology in primary and secondary schools
Ban critical race theory in primary and secondary schools

additionalInfo: The Windsor Framework simplifies trade rules between Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK while preserving Northern Ireland's access to the EU market.
text: Abandon the Windsor Framework

additionalInfo: Public toilets and changing areas must provide single sex facilities, including in schools.
text: Mandate single sex spaces
Ban all ULEZ and Low Traffic Neighbourhoods
Stop postal voting except for the elderly, disabled or those who can’t leave their homes.
Introduce proportional representation voting for the House of Commons
additionalInfo: Proportional representation allocates legislative seats based on vote percentages, aiming for fairness, but it can lead to unstable coalition governments.

text: Keep the corporation tax rate at 25%
Double the number of NHS CT and MRI scanners
Free breakfast clubs in every primary school
Apply VAT and business rates to private school fees
Scrap the Rwanda deportation scheme
additionalInfo: The Rwanda deportation scheme involves the UK government sending asylum seekers to Rwanda for processing and settlement, aiming to deter illegal immigration and human trafficking.

text: Invest £855m in HMRC to reduce tax avoidance
Open an additional 3,000 nurseries
Abolish Section 21 ‘no fault’ evictions
additionalInfo: Section 21 allows landlords in England and Wales to evict tenants without providing a reason.

text: Lower the voting age to 16
Ban advertising junk food to children along with the sale of high-caffeine energy drinks to under-16s

additionalInfo: Great British Energy aims to cut bills for good and boost energy security, paid for by a windfall tax on oil and gas giants.
text: Set up Great British Energy, a publicly-owned clean power company
Recruit 6,500 new teachers in key subjects
additionalInfo: New teachers in key subjects will aim to prepare children for life, work and the future, paid for by ending tax breaks for private schools.

text: No increases to national insurance, income tax or VAT
Fix an additional 1 million potholes per year across England
additionalInfo: This will be funded by deferring the A27 bypass.
Railways will be brought back into public ownership as contracts with existing operators expire or are broken through a failure to deliver.
text: Reforming the railways and bring them into public ownership
Build 1.5 million new homes

additionalInfo:
Give regulators new powers to block the payment of bonuses to executives who pollute our waterways.

Bring criminal charges against persistent law breakers.
text: Put failing water companies under special measures to clean up our water
Ban trail hunting and the import of hunting trophies
Introduce new laws to crack down on puppy smuggling
Ban so-called conversion therapy
additionalInfo: "So-called conversion therapy" refers to practices aimed at changing an individual's sexual orientation or gender identity.
